value.title: Get Data from Multiple Excel Files with Different Sheet Names into Power BI

In this video, I‚Äôll explain a method you can use that works regardless of the sheet names. Download the sample files from my

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: One Dimension Filters Another Dimension in Power BI
value.excerpt: I often get this question after I explain about the star-schema. The question is that both my dimensions are filtering my fact table values, but how can I get one dimension filtering another dimension? for example, how can I get only the list of products that have been purchased by this customer? In

value.title: Secure the Sensitive Data in Power BI   Data Masking better with Row Level Security
value.excerpt: In my previous article/video, I explained how you can hide sensitive data from the user's view. The method I explained there is a simple method, however, for a specific type of user. If you have users who are using Power BI Desktop to create reports on top of your model, and they are going to create

value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. There is a very simple way of doing it, which I am going to explain in this post. Substring means getting part of a string, for example from "Reza Rad", if I want to get the start starting from
